title: SQL Review - Books Database
description: Practice writing SQL queries on a books database. Write and execute your queries to see the results in real-time.
relations: books (book_id, book_name, year, genre, author_id, times_trending)

schema.books:
CREATE TABLE books (
    book_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    book_name VARCHAR(100),
    year INT,
    genre VARCHAR(50),
    author_id INT,
    times_trending INT
);

questionContext: This is a practice exercise to help you review SQL query fundamentals. Write your queries in the SQL editor below and click 'Run Query' to execute them and see the results.

questions.title: Task 1 [5 pt]
questions.text: Select only the book names and years from the books table.
questions.hint: Use SELECT to choose specific columns from the books table.

questions.title: Task 2 [5 pt]
questions.text: Find the names of all authors whose debut year is in the 21st century (defined as after 2000).
questions.correctQuery: SELECT author_name FROM authors WHERE debut_year >= 2001;
questions.hint: Use WHERE clause with a condition on debut_year. The 21st century starts in 2001.
